member.name: T:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareManager
member.summary: Provides informations about the DocuVieware running process.

member.name: M:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareManager.SetupConfiguration
member.summary: Setup the configuration required by DocuVieware.

member.name: M:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareManager.SetupConfiguration(System.Boolean,GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareSessionStateMode,System.String)
member.summary: Setup the configuration required by DocuVieware.
member.param:
Specifies if DocuVieware is hosted in a single server or in a Server Farm with sticky sessions (also known as session affinity).
To maximize performances, it is highly recommended to keep this property to true in the context of single server or Server Farm with sticky sessions hosting. (Default value is true)

Specifies the path of the cache folder, if any.
If available, the cache folder will be used to store large data blob.
It is highly recommended to setup such folder otherwise all data will be cached into the server memory.
The cache system has been designed to keep the memory footprint as low as possible.
No action is required from your side, the recycling and garbage collector mechanisms are already implemented and automatically at work when necessary.
Default value is null (no file caching).
member.remarks: If sticky sessions mode is disabled, a cache folder that is reachable from all the servers in the farm must be provided.

member.name: M:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareManager.SetupConfiguration(System.Boolean,GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareSessionStateMode,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Setup the configuration required by DocuVieware.
member.param:
Specifies if DocuVieware is hosted in a single server or in a Server Farm with sticky sessions (also known as session affinity).
To maximize performances, it is highly recommended to keep this property to true in the context of single server or Server Farm with sticky sessions hosting. (Default value is true)

Specifies the path of the cache folder, if any.
If available, the cache folder will be used to store large data blob.
It is highly recommended to setup such folder otherwise all data will be cached into the server memory.
The cache system has been designed to keep the memory footprint as low as possible.
No action is required from your side, the recycling and garbage collector mechanisms are already implemented and automatically at work when necessary.
Default value is null (no file caching).
Specifies the web application URI.

Specifies the route of the DocuVieware controler if you have implemented the controller from your web application IE: api/docuvieware3. This is required for .NET Core web applications. Using an empty string will leave DocuVieware to create the route.
member.remarks: If sticky sessions mode is disabled, a cache folder that is reachable from all the servers in the farm must be provided.

member.name: M:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareManager.SetStickyPageSessionMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies if DocuVieware control states are associated to a page's absolute path rather than a page's instance.
member.param: Set true to associate each control instances to its page's absolute path (default mode), false otherwise.
member.remarks: Keeping this mode enabled permits to minimize server overhead.

member.param: An unique identifier specifying the id of the new session to create.
The identifier of the DocuVieware control that will be associated with the new session.
Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, allowed between requests before the DocuVieware session-state provider terminates the session.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.summary: Destroys all the objects handled by the specified Docuvieware session. If the the AbandonSession method is not explicitly called, the server automatically call it when the session times out.

member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.summary: Specifies the text to display. It can be html text (with tags) if isHtmlText properties is set to True.

member.summary: Specifies the DocuViewareMessage box background color. It must contains CSS Color values. By default : "#85ACDD".

member.summary: Specifies the DocuViewareMessage box display delay (in milli seconds). By default : 2500.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareMessage.slideUpDelay
member.summary: Specifies the DocuViewareMessage box slideUp animation delay (in milli seconds). By default : 300.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareMessage.slideDownDelay
member.summary: Specifies the DocuViewareMessage box slideDown animation delay (in milli seconds). By default : 300.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareMessage.isHtmlText
member.summary: Specifies whether the displayed text is in html format in the DocuViewareMessage box. If True, html tags will be interpreted. By default : false.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareMessage.fontSize
member.summary: Specifies the DocuViewareMessage box font size. It must be CSS font size format. By default : "130%".

member.name: F:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareMessage.fontWeight
member.summary: Specifies the DocuViewareMessage box font weight. It must be CSS font weight format. By default : "normal".

member.name: F:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareMessage.fontColor
member.summary: Specifies the DocuViewareMessage box font color. It must be CSS color values. By default : "#FFFFFF".

member.name: F:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareMessage.textDecoration
member.summary: Specifies the DocuViewareMessage box text decoration. It must be CSS text decoration values. By default : "none".

member.name: F:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareMessage.textTransform
member.summary: Specifies the DocuViewareMessage box text transformation. It must be CSS text transformation values. By default : 130%.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareMessage.messageBoxHeight
member.summary: Specifies the DocuViewareMessage box height. It must be CSS height format. By default : 130%.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareMessage.icon
member.summary: Specifies the DocuViewareMessage box icon. By default : DocuViewareMessageIcon.None.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuViewareMessage.customIcon
member.summary: Specifies the custom DocuViewareMessage box icon. When filled, the value specifies the HTML content of the element. For example It is ignored if Icon property is different of DocuViewareMessageIcon.None.

member.name: M:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.GetAnnotationCount(System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the number of annotations within the current page or within the entire document.
member.param: When the parameter is set on "true", annotations of all pages will be counted. Otherwise only the annotations of the current page will be enumerated.
The number of annotation.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.SaveAnnotations(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves the document's annotations into a stream.
member.param: A System.IO.Stream object where the annotations will be saved.
When the parameter is set on "true", annotations on all pages will be saved. Otherwise only the annotations of the current page will be saved.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.summary: Load document's annotations from a stream.

member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

A System.IO.Stream object that will contain the document content, in PDF format.

member.name: M:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.TwainSetCapCurrentNumeric(GdPicture14.TwainCapabilities,System.Double)
member.summary: Changes the initial value of a TWAIN capability from a numeric value. This method permits to control any supported capability of the TWAIN acquisition device being selected, through the TWAIN capabilities mechanism.
member.param: A member of the TwainCapabilities enumeration. The TWAIN capability to change. A complete description of each capability can be found into the TWAIN specifications.
The TWAIN capability value.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.
member.remarks: This method automatically switches the TwainSourceEnableCustomConfiguration to true.

member.name: M:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.TwainSetCapCurrentString(GdPicture14.TwainCapabilities,System.String)
member.summary: Changes the initial value of a TWAIN capability from a string value. This method permits to control any supported capability of the TWAIN acquisition device being selected, through the TWAIN capabilities mechanism.
member.param: A member of the TwainCapabilities enumeration. The TWAIN capability to change. A complete description of each capability can be found into the TWAIN specifications.
The TWAIN capability value.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.
member.remarks: This method automatically switches the TwainSourceEnableCustomConfiguration to true.

member.name: M:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.GetNativePDF(GdPicture14.GdPicturePDF@)
member.summary: If the native document is a PDF, this method provides access to the native GdPicturePDF object used to handle it.
member.param: The native GdPicturePDF object. Do not dispose or close this object.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.
member.remarks: If the native document is not a PDF GdPictureStatus.Aborted will be returned. To determine if the native document is a PDF the GetDocumentType() method can be used.

member.name: M:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.GetNativeImage(System.Int32@)
member.summary: If the native document is a raster (or bitmap), this method provides access to the native GdPicture image used to handle it.
member.param: The native GdPicture Image. This image must not be released from the memory.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.
member.remarks: If the native document is not a bitmap GdPictureStatus.Aborted will be returned. To determine if the native document is a raster the GetDocumentType() method can be used.

member.name: M:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.RedrawPage
member.summary: Call this method to redraw the current page on the client side.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.
member.remarks: Page redraw in client side can be used to reflect content updated in the server side.

member.name: M:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.ReloadAnnotations
member.summary: Call this method to reload the current page annotations on the client side.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.RedrawPages(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Call this method to redraw specific pages on the client side.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.
member.remarks: It is important to call this method after document page editing subsequent to a GetNativePDF() or GetNativeImage() call.

member.name: M:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.OnSessionRequired(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method must be called before accessing the attached Session object of the control (the DocuViewareControl.Session field).
member.param: When true specifies that a new Session object must be created if it has not been previously generated.
member.remarks: An unique Session object is attached for each DocuVieware control. For performance and recycling purposes it can be generated on demand, at any step of the object life cycle.
member.returns: True if the session is recycled, false otherwise.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.RenderingEngine
member.summary: Specifies the rendering engine used by this DocuVieware instance.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.RasterizerPixelSizeLimit
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of pixels (vertically or horizontally) that the internal rasterizer is permitted to produce. The higher the value, the higher the maximum zoom will be for displaying non-raster documents (IE: PDF). Default value is -1 (automatically computed).

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.ForceHTTPS
member.summary: Specifies the protocol of communication used by the application hosting the DocuVieware control. By default DocuVieware tries to determine if the application is running in http or https protocol. If the application is known to be run in HTTPS mode this property should be switched to true.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.ID
member.summary: Gets or sets the programmatic identifier assigned to the DocuVieware control.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.Timeout
member.summary: Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, allowed between requests before the DocuVieware session-state provider terminates the session.
member.remarks: Use -1 to use the same timeout as the asp.net session state, otherwise a value superior or equal to 1 is required. Default value is 20 minutes.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.PrintQuality
member.summary: Specifies the print quality that DocuVieware uses for the job.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.TextSearchMaxResults
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of results provided by a text search request.
member.remarks: Default value is 100. Use -1 for an unlimited number.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.CustomHeaders
member.summary: Specifies custom headers for the generated ajax requests.
member.remarks: Default value is null. CustomHeaders must be in JSON format. For example CustomHeaders = "{\"Authorization\":\"Basic xxxxxxxxxxxxx\", \"X_CSRF_TOKEN\":\"xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx\"}".

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.CustomNotificationIconOk
member.summary:
Custom success notification icon.
Used to specify a custom icon within success notification boxes.
member.remarks: Default value is empty. When filled, the value specifies the HTML content of the element. For example .

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.AllowedExportFormats
member.summary:
Specifies extensions of the allowed formats for export. Each extension must be separated by a coma.
Wildcard character '*' can be used to specify any supported format.
The following extensions are currently supported: "PDF", "TIFF".
For example use "*" to allow all supported format for export, "PDF" to allow only PDF export and "PDF,TIFF" to allow PDF and TIFF export.
member.remarks:
It is highly recommended to allow only the PDF format in order to prevent from high server usage and high volume of data transfer.
Default value is "*".

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.EnableTextSelection
member.summary: Specifies whether text selection is permitted.
member.remarks: Holding Alt key during selection permits to switch to column selection mode instead of the default line selection mode. Default value is true.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.EnableTextSelectionAnnotation
member.summary: Specifies whether the selected text context menu options should contain annotations entries.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.CurrentPage
member.summary: Current page of the displayed document, starts from 1 (Read-Only).

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.PageCount
member.summary: Number of pages in the displayed document (Read-Only).

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.EnableFormFieldsEdition
member.summary: Specifies whether form fields can be edited into the client browser or not.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.AnnotationEditorMode
member.summary: Specifies the editor mode for the GdPicture/XMP annotation support.
member.remarks:
Setting true permits the end user to edit available GdPicture/XMP annotations. Setting false locks all annotations.
Default value is true.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.EnableGdPictureAnnotations
member.summary: Specifies whether GdPicture/XMP annotations support is activated.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.AnnotationDropShadow
member.summary: Specifies whether GdPicture/XMP annotations are rendered with a drop shadow effect.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.SinglePageView
member.summary:
Specifies whether the viewer displays only one page at once.
When set to false, the viewer displays multiple document pages on the screen at the same time.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.DocumentAlignment
member.summary:
Default image alignment within the viewer when the area of the viewer is smaller than the displayed document in its current zoom configuration.
Setting this property to DocumentAlignmentTopLeft has the effect to display the most top-left part of the displayed page during "Zoom In" operations.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.DocumentPosition
member.summary: Default page position within the viewer when the rendering area of the displayed document in its current zoom configuration is smaller than the area of the viewer.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.Zoom
member.summary: Specifies the current factor of zoom applied during page rendering operations: 1 for 100%, 1.5 for 150%, 2 for 200%...

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.ZoomMode
member.summary: Specifies the zoom mode used by the viewer.
member.remarks:
The ZoomModeToViewer is not yet supported.
Default value is ViewerZoomMode.ZoomModeShrinkToViewerWidth.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.OpenZoomMode
member.summary: Specifies the zoom mode to set when a new document is loaded.

member.name: P:GdPicture14.WEB.DocuVieware.ZoomStep
member.summary: Defines the percentage of increasing or decreasing level of zoom for 'Zoom In' and 'Zoom Out' operations.

member.name: P:GdPicture.WEB.DocuViewareCore.DocuViewareActions.DocumentAlignment
member.summary: Default image alignment within the viewer when the area of the viewer if smaller than the displayed document in its current zoom configuration. Setting this property to DocumentAlignmentTopLeft has the effect to display the most top-left part of the displayed page during "Zoom In" operations. Default value is ViewerDocumentAlignment.DocumentAlignmentMiddleCenter.

member.name: P:GdPicture.WEB.DocuViewareCore.DocuViewareActions.DocumentPosition
member.summary: Default page position within the viewer when the rendering area of the displayed document in its current zoom configuration if smaller than then area of the viewer. Default value is ViewerDocumentPosition.DocumentPositionMiddleCenter.

member.name: P:GdPicture.WEB.DocuViewareCore.DocuViewareActions.ZoomMode
member.summary: Zoom mode used by the viewer. Default value is ViewerZoomMode.ZoomMode100.

member.name: P:GdPicture.WEB.DocuViewareCore.DocuViewareActions.Zoom
member.summary: The current factor of zoom applied during page rendering operations. 1 for 100%, 1.5 for 150%, 2 for 200%...

member.name: P:GdPicture.WEB.DocuViewareCore.DocuViewareActions.ZoomMax
member.summary: The maximum zoom factor which can be used with the displayed document.

member.name: P:GdPicture.WEB.DocuViewareCore.DocuViewareActions.ZoomMin
member.summary: The minimum zoom factor which can be used with the displayed document.

member.name: P:GdPicture.WEB.DocuViewareCore.DocuViewareActions.ZoomStep
member.summary: Defines the percentage of increasing or decreasing of the level of zoom for 'Zoom In' and 'Zoom Out' operations. Default value is 25.

member.name: P:GdPicture.WEB.DocuViewareCore.DocuViewareActions.ViewRotation
member.summary: Defines the current view rotation of the canvas.

member.name: P:GdPicture.WEB.DocuViewareCore.DocuViewareActions.RenderRotation
member.summary: The combination of PageRotation and ViewRotation that represents the final rendering rotation of the current page.

member.name: P:GdPicture.WEB.DocuViewareCore.DocuViewareActions.PageRotation
member.summary: The current page rotation of the displayed document.

member.name: P:GdPicture.WEB.DocuViewareCore.DocuViewareActions.DocumentType
member.summary: The type of the document. A member of the DocumentType enumeration. (Read-Only).

member.name: P:GdPicture.WEB.DocuViewareCore.DocuViewareActions.DocumentFormat
member.summary: The format of the document. A member of the DocumentFormat enumeration. (Read-Only).

member.summary: Specifies the zoom mode used by the viewer.

The ZoomModeToViewer is not yet supported.
Default value is ViewerZoomMode.ZoomModeShrinkToViewerWidth.

member.name: F:GdPicture.WEB.DocuViewareCore.Sessions.DocuViewareControlState.AllowedExportFormats
member.summary:
Specifies extensions of the allowed formats for export. Each extension must be separated by a coma.
Wildcard character '*' can be used to specify any supported format.
The following extensions are currently supported: "PDF", "TIFF".
For example use "*" to allow all supported format for export, "PDF" to allow only PDF export and "PDF,TIFF" to allow PDF and TIFF export.
member.remarks:
It is highly recommended to allow only the PDF format in order to prevent from high server usage and high volume of data transfer.
Default value is "*".

member.name: M:GdPicture.WEB.DocuViewareCore.Sessions.Session.consumeProxyEvents(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method must be internally called to consume all pending proxy events. Proxy events are automatically stacked (see Proxy_UpdateView) before being executed in order to reduce the number of client/server update processes.
member.param: Specifies that full page content must be reloaded, whatever the page cache state is.
When true, result and message fields of the client context are set to null.
When true, the current page thumbnail is updated on the client side if the page must be updated.

member.name: T:GdPicture.WEB.DocuViewareCore.Sessions.SessionFactory
member.summary: Entity responsible to maintain persistency of DocuVieware objects into ASP sessions.

member.name: M:GdPicture.WEB.DocuViewareCore.Sessions.SessionFactory.getDocuviewareSession(System.String,GdPicture.WEB.DocuViewareCore.Sessions.DocuViewareControlState,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Obtains a Docuvieware session (recycled, or new one).
member.param: The session unique ID.
A DocuViewareControlState object storing the associated control state.
A boolean specifying whether the associated DocuVieware object is being rendered for the first time or is being loaded in response to a postback.
Specifies the timeout of the session, in minutes.
If true, speficies that a new session is created if a session can not be found in the cache.
If true, a newly created session has its state immediatly saved.
Output parameter. If true, specifies that the returned Session object was already existing.
member.returns: A Session object or a null reference.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.SegmentationMode
member.summary: Specifies different modes of the segmentation process.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.SegmentationMode.ConnectedComponents4
member.summary: Finds bounding boxes of 4-connected components using the Paul Heckbert's stack-based seed fill algorithm. Each detected box is stored within a block.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.SegmentationMode.ConnectedComponents8
member.summary: Finds bounding boxes of 8-connected components using the Paul Heckbert's stack-based seed fill algorithm. Each detected box is stored within a block.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.SegmentationMode.PageLayout
member.summary: Identifies page's layout and stores the result into blocks, paragraphes, lines, words and characters.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.RAWImageLoadingOptions
member.summary: Specifies how RAW images must be decoded.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.RAWImageLoadingOptions.Preview
member.summary: Tries to load the embedded JPEG preview bitmap, if such bitmap is not available, the image will be developed to sRGB color space.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.RAWImageLoadingOptions.Display
member.summary: Develops the image to sRGB color space using a gamma of 2.4 / 12.92.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.RAWImageLoadingOptions.LoadHalf
member.summary: Develops the image to half of its original size.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.RAWImageLoadingOptions.RawColorSpace
member.summary: Develops the image to RAW color space using a gamma of 1 / 1.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.RAWImageLoadingOptions.AutomaticBrightness
member.summary: Applies automatic brightness adjustment during the development.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus
member.summary: Identifies the status of the currently executed operation.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.OK
member.summary: The executed method has been successfully followed, that is without any errors.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.GenericError
member.summary: An error occurred inside the calling method, mostly internal key elements are invalid. This is an error, which can't be identified more precisely, let's say by other elements of this enumeration.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.InvalidParameter
member.summary: One of the arguments passed to the method is not valid.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.OutOfMemory
member.summary: The operating system is out of memory and cannot allocate memory to process the method call.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.ObjectBusy
member.summary: One of the arguments specified in the API is already in use in another thread.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.InsufficientBuffer
member.summary: A buffer specified as an argument in the API is not large enough to hold the received data.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.NotImplemented
member.summary: The calling method is not implemented yet.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.Win32Error
member.summary: The calling method generated a Microsoft Win32 error.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.WrongState
member.summary: The current object is in the invalid state to satisfy the API call.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.Aborted
member.summary: The calling method has been aborted, mostly because of the insufficient pre-conditions.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.FileNotFound
member.summary: The specified file (the image file, the input document) or the metafile could not be found.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.ValueOverflow
member.summary: The method performed an arithmetic operation, that produced a numeric overflow.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.AccessDenied
member.summary: The required write operation is not allowed on the specified file.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.UnknownImageFormat
member.summary: The format of the specified image file is unknown, unsupported or invalid.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.FontFamilyNotFound
member.summary: The specified font family could not be found. Either the font family name is incorrect or the font family is not installed.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.FontStyleNotFound
member.summary: The specified style is not available for the specified font family.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.NotTrueTypeFont
member.summary: The font retrieved from an HDC or LOGFONT is not a TrueType font and cannot be used with GdPicture.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.UnsupportedGdiplusVersion
member.summary: The version of GDI+ installed on the system is incompatible with the version GdPicture need.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.GdiplusNotInitialized
member.summary: The GDI+ API is not in an initialized state. This one should never appear.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.PropertyNotFound
member.summary: The specified property does not exist in the target.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.PropertyNotSupported
member.summary: The specified property is not supported by the format of the target, therefore, cannot be set.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.ProfileNotFound
member.summary: The color profile, that requires to save an image in CMYK format, has not been found.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.UnsupportedImageFormat
member.summary: The format of the image is not supported by the method.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.TemplateNotFound
member.summary: The template has not been found by the GdPicture ADR engine.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.PrintingException
member.summary: An exception has been raised by the system during the printing process.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.OperationTimedOut
member.summary: The operation timed out.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.GdPictureStatus.SegmentationError
member.summary: The segmentation process failed.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfConformance
member.summary:
Specifies PDF versions and conformance levels of a PDF document.
The PDF versions correspond to the PDF major releases, starting from PDF 1.0. In each PDF version the new features have been introduced. The different conformance levels reflect the quality of the archived document and depend on the input material and the documents purpose. PDF/A versions and levels are given one after another.
PDF/A-1 is the first archiving standard based on PDF version 1.4. All resources must be embedded within the PDF/A document itself.
PDF/A-2 is based on PDF 1.7. It allows JPEG2000 compression, transparent elements, PDF layers and more.
PDF/A-3 is available since October 2012. It allows to embed any file format desired.
Level a (accessible) meets all requirements for the standard.
Level b (basic) guaranteed that the content of the document can be unambiguously reproduced.
Level u (unicode) specifies that all text can be mapped to standard Unicode character codes.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfConformance.Unknown
member.summary: The PDF conformance level is unknown.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfRasterizerEngine
member.summary: Defines the Microsoft Windows application programming interface used to render PDF documents.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRasterizerEngine.PdfRasterizerEngineGdiplus
member.summary:
GdiPlus.
Pros: very fast path painting. Low memory usage.
Cons: uses internal lock which considerably decreases performance when used in multiple threads. Slow image rendering.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRasterizerEngine.PdfRasterizerEngineWPF
member.summary:
Windows Presentation Foundation.
Pros: supports antialiasing in clipping path. Fast image rendering. Produces very high performance in multithreaded applications.
Cons: slower path painting than GdiPlus. Requires more memory than GdiPlus.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRasterizerEngine.PdfRasterizerEngineSkia
member.summary: Do not use yet.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRasterizerEngine.PdfRasterizerEngineHybrid
member.summary: This engine mix all supported programming interfaces in order to favor rendering quality, speed, and multithread performance.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfImageMaskType
member.summary: Specifies the type of the image masking.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfImageMaskType.PdfMaskTypeUnknown
member.summary: Unknown mask mode.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfImageMaskType.PdfMaskTypeNone
member.summary: Standard bitmap without masking operation.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfImageMaskType.PdfMaskTypeStencil
member.summary: A monochrome image, in which each sample is specified by a single bit. However, instead of being painted in opaque black and white, the image mask is treated as a stencil mask, that is partly opaque and partly transparent. Sample values in the image do not represent black and white pixels, rather, they designate places on the page that should either be marked with the current color or masked out (not marked at all). Areas, which are masked out, retain their former content. The effect is like applying paint in the current color through a cut-out stencil, which lets the paint reach the page in some places and masks it out in others.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfImageMaskType.PdfMaskTypeExplicit
member.summary: In PDF 1.3, the Mask entry in an image dictionary may be an image mask, as described above under Stencil Masking, which serves as an explicit mask for the primary (base) image. The base image and the image mask need not have the same resolution (Width and Height values), but since all images are defined on the unit square in user space, their boundaries on the page will coincide, that is, they will overlay each other. The image mask indicates which places on the page are to be painted and which are to be masked out (left unchanged). Unmasked areas are painted with the corresponding portions of the base image, masked areas are not.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfImageMaskType.PdfMaskTypeSoft
member.summary: Defines the Alpha channel to be applied to another image.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfImageMaskType.PdfMaskTypeColorKey
member.summary: In PDF 1.3, the Mask entry in an image dictionary may alternatively be an array specifying a range of colors to be masked out. Samples in the image, that fall within this range, are not painted, allowing the existing background to show through. The effect is similar to that of the video technique known as chroma-key.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfViewerPreference
member.summary: Specifies the viewer preference settings to control the way the document is presented on the screen in Adobe Reader or Acrobat viewer.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfViewerPreference.PdfViewerPreferenceHideToolbar
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer applications tool bars when the document is active. Default value: false.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfViewerPreference.PdfViewerPreferenceHideMenubar
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer applications menu bar when the document is active. Default value: false.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfViewerPreference.PdfViewerPreferenceHideWindowUI
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to hide user interface elements in the documents window (such as scroll bars and navigation controls), leaving only the documents content displayed. Default value: false.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfViewerPreference.PdfViewerPreferenceFitWindow
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to resize the documents window to fit the size of the first displayed page. Default value: false.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfViewerPreference.PdfViewerPreferenceCenterWindow
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to position the documents window in the center of the screen. Default value: false.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfViewerPreference.PdfViewerPreferenceDisplayDocTitle
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A flag specifying whether the windows title bar should display the document title taken from the Title entry of the document information dictionary. If false, the title bar should instead display the name of the PDF file containing the document. Default value: false.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureMode
member.summary: Specifies the security handler.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureMode.PdfSignatureModeAdobePPKMS
member.summary: On Windows, the Adobe.PPKMS security handler provides access through the Microsoft Active Directory Script Interface (ADSI) to all the directories the user created in the Security Settings Console. Unsupported for Linux and Macintosh.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureMode.PdfSignatureModeAdobePPKLite
member.summary: Adobe's default security handler used for performing private key functions, validating signatures, and signing and encrypting documents.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureMode.PdfSignatureModeAdobeCADES
member.summary: CMS Advanced Electronic Signatures. Supports long term validation of signatures even when the signing certificate is revoked; this is part of the feature which allows adding an invisible timestamp signature to a document.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureType
member.summary: For the internal use only.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureType.SignatureTypeUnknown
member.summary: Unknown signature type.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureType.SignatureTypePlaceHolder
member.summary: No signature.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureType.SignatureTypeAdobePPKLite
member.summary: AdobePPKlite.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureCertificationLevel
member.summary: Specifies the level of the signature certification.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureCertificationLevel.NotCertified
member.summary: Standard digital signature. PDF documents can be digitally signed many times.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureCertificationLevel.NoChanges
member.summary: No changes to the document are permitted, every subsequent change to the document invalidates the certificate.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureCertificationLevel.FormFilling
member.summary: Only form filling and signing tools are allowed. Any other changes to the document are not permitted.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureCertificationLevel.FormFillingAndAnnotations
member.summary: Allowed changes are form filling, instantiating page templates, signing and commenting, any other changes invalidate the certificate.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureHash
member.summary: Specifies the SHA (hash) algorithm to use while signing.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureHash.SHA1
member.summary: SHA-1 (deprecated from 2016 onward)

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureHash.SHA256
member.summary: SHA-256 (recommended as default)

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureHash.SHA512
member.summary: SHA-512

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureHash.SHA224
member.summary: SHA-224

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfSignatureHash.SHA384
member.summary: SHA-384

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationFlag
member.summary: Specifies various characteristics of the annotation.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagDefault
member.summary: Flags are undefined.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagInvisible
member.summary: If set, do not display the annotation if it does not belong to one of the standard annotation types and no annotation handler is available. If clear, display such an unknown annotation using an appearance stream specified by its appearance dictionary, if any.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagHidden
member.summary: (PDF 1.2) If set, do not display or print the annotation or allow it to interact with the user, regardless of its annotation type or whether an annotation handler is available. In cases where screen space is limited, the ability to hide and show annotations selectively can be used in combination with appearance streams.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagPrint
member.summary: (PDF 1.2) If set, print the annotation when the page is printed. If clear, never print the annotation, regardless of whether it is displayed on the screen. This can be useful, for example, for annotations representing interactive pushbuttons, which would serve no meaningful purpose on the printed page.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagNoZoom
member.summary: (PDF 1.3) If set, do not scale the annotations appearance to match the magnification of the page. The location of the annotation on the page (defined by the upper-left corner of its annotation rectangle) remains fixed, regardless of the page magnification.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagNoRotate
member.summary: (PDF 1.3) If set, do not rotate the annotations appearance to match the rotation of the page. The upper-left corner of the annotation rectangle remains in a fixed location on the page, regardless of the page rotation.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagNoView
member.summary: (PDF 1.3) If set, do not display the annotation on the screen or allow it to interact with the user. The annotation may be printed (depending on the setting of the Print flag), but should be considered hidden for purposes of on-screen display and user interaction.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagReadOnly
member.summary: (PDF 1.3) If set, do not allow the annotation to interact with the user. The annotation may be displayed or printed (depending on the settings of the NoView and Print flags), but should not respond to mouse clicks or change its appearance in response to mouse motions. Note: This flag is ignored for widget annotations; its function is subsumed by the ReadOnly flag of the associated form field.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagLocked
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, do not allow the annotation to be deleted or its properties (including position and size) to be modified by the user. However, this flag does not restrict changes to the annotations content, such as the value of a form field.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagToggleNoView
member.summary: (PDF 1.5) If set, invert the interpretation of the NoView flag for certain events. A typical use is to have an annotation that appears only when a mouse cursor is held over it.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagLockedContents
member.summary: (PDF 1.7) If set, do not allow the content of the annotation to be modified by the user. This flag does not restrict deletion of the annotation or changes to other annotation properties, such as position and size.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfFormFieldType
member.summary: Specifies the type of the form field.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfFormFieldType.PdfFormFieldTypeUnknown
member.summary: Unknown or undefined type of the form field.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfFormFieldType.PdfFormFieldTypePushButton
member.summary: A pushbutton is a purely interactive control that responds immediately to user input without retaining a permanent value.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfFormFieldType.PdfFormFieldTypeCheckBoxButton
member.summary: A check box toggles between two states, on and off.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfFormFieldType.PdfFormFieldTypeRadioButton
member.summary: Radio button fields contain a set of related buttons, that can each be on or off. Typically, at most one radio button in a set may be on at any given time, and selecting any one of the buttons automatically deselects all the others.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfFormFieldType.PdfFormFieldTypeText
member.summary: A text field is a box or space, in which the user can enter text from the keyboard.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfFormFieldType.PdfFormFieldTypeChoice
member.summary: Choice fields contain several text items, at most one of which may be selected as the field value. They include scrollable list boxes and combo boxes.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfFormFieldType.PdfFormFieldTypeSignature
member.summary: A signature field represents electronic signature for authenticating the identity of a user and the validity of the documents content.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfFormFieldType.PdfFormFieldTypeList
member.summary: A list box represents a scrollable choice form field, whose content are determined interactively at the time the document is displayed.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfFormFieldType.PdfFormFieldTypeCombo
member.summary: A combo box consists of a drop-down list optionally accompanied by an editable text box, in which the user can type a value other than the predefined choices.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfFormFieldVisibility
member.summary: Defines the visibility of the form field, either on screen or in print.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfFormFieldVisibility.PdfFormFieldVisible
member.summary: The form field is fully visible, both on screen and when printed.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfFormFieldVisibility.PdfFormFieldHidden
member.summary: The form field is hidden, both on screen and when printed.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfFormFieldVisibility.PdfFormFieldVisibleNotPrintable
member.summary: The form field is visible on screen, but can't be printed.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfFormFieldVisibility.PdfFormFieldHidenPrintable
member.summary: The form field is hidden on screen, but is is visible when printed.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationBorderStyle
member.summary: Specifies the annotation's border style.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationBorderStyle.PdfAnnotationBorderStyleSolid
member.summary: Solid - A solid rectangle surrounding the annotation. The default value.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationBorderStyle.PdfAnnotationBorderStyleDashed
member.summary: Dashed - A dashed rectangle surrounding the annotation. You can specify the dash pattern.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationBorderStyle.PdfAnnotationBorderStyleBeveled
member.summary: Beveled - A simulated embossed rectangle that appears to be raised above the surface of the page.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationBorderStyle.PdfAnnotationBorderStyleInset
member.summary: Inset - A simulated engraved rectangle that appears to be recessed below the surface of the page.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationBorderStyle.PdfAnnotationBorderStyleUnderline
member.summary: Underline - A single line along the bottom of the annotation rectangle.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfCheckBoxStyle
member.summary: Specifies a graphical style of a checkmark in check boxes and radio buttons, when they are checked.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfCheckBoxStyle.PdfCheckBoxStyleCheck
member.summary: Check.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfCheckBoxStyle.PdfCheckBoxStyleCircle
member.summary: Circle.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfCheckBoxStyle.PdfCheckBoxStyleCross
member.summary: Cross.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfCheckBoxStyle.PdfCheckBoxStyleDiamond
member.summary: Diamond.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfCheckBoxStyle.PdfCheckBoxStyleSquare
member.summary: Square.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfCheckBoxStyle.PdfCheckBoxStyleStar
member.summary: Star.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyle
member.summary: Specifies an annotation's line ending style.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyle.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyleSquare
member.summary: A square filled with the annotations interior color, if any.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyle.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyleCircle
member.summary: A circle filled with the annotations interior color, if any.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyle.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyleDiamond
member.summary: A diamond shape filled with the annotations interior color, if any.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyle.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyleOpenArrow
member.summary: Two short lines meeting in an acute angle to form an open arrowhead.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyle.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyleClosedArrow
member.summary: Two short lines meeting in an acute angle as in the OpenArrow style and connected by a third line to form a triangular closed arrowhead filled with the annotations interior color, if any.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyle.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyleNone
member.summary: No line ending.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyle.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyleButt
member.summary: (PDF 1.5) A short line at the endpoint perpendicular to the line itself.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyle.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyleROpenArrow
member.summary: (PDF 1.5) Two short lines in the reverse direction from OpenArrow.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyle.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyleRClosedArrow
member.summary: (PDF 1.5) A triangular closed arrowhead in the reverse direction from ClosedArrow.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyle.PdfAnnotationLineEndingStyleSlash
member.summary: (PDF 1.6) A short line at the endpoint approximately 30 degrees clockwise from perpendicular to the line itself.

member.summary: Defines the boundary boxes (page boxes) that relate to the size of the pages in the PDF document.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfPageBox.PdfPageBoxMediaBox
member.summary: Defines the boundaries of the physical medium on which the page is intended to be displayed or printed. This mostly equals to the actual page size.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfPageBox.PdfPageBoxCropBox
member.summary: Defines the visible region. When the page is displayed or printed, its content are to be clipped (cropped) to this rectangle and then imposed on the output medium.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfPageBox.PdfPageBoxBleedBox
member.summary: Defines the region to which the content of the page should be clipped when output in a production environment.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfPageBox.PdfPageBoxTrimBox
member.summary: Defines the intended dimensions of the finished page after trimming.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfPageBox.PdfPageBoxArtBox
member.summary: Defines the extent of the pages meaningful content (including potential white space) as intended by the pages creator.

member.summary: Specifies access permissions to the various operations within the PDF document.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRight.PdfRightCanView
member.summary: Allows the user to view the document. Always available.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRight.PdfRightCanPrint
member.summary: Allows the user to print the document, but possibly not at the highest quality level, see also PdfRightCanPrintFull.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRight.PdfRightCanModify
member.summary: Allows the user to modify the document.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRight.PdfRightCanCopy
member.summary: Allows the user to copy or extract text and graphics from the document.

member.summary: Allows the user to add annotations.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRight.PdfRightCanCopyAccess
member.summary: Enables copying or extracting for use with accessibility features. Only works with 128-bit encryption.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRight.PdfRightCanAssemble
member.summary: Allows the user to assemble the document. Only works with 128-bit encryption.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRight.PdfRightCanPrintFull
member.summary: Allows high resolution printing of the document. Only works with 128-bit encryption.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRight.PdfRightAll
member.summary: Allows everything.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfEncryptionMode
member.summary:
Specifies the security handler mechanism used for PDF document's encryption.
The file's security handler provides a mechanism that not only implements encryption in PDF documents, but also stores all data related to this process. The PDF specification defines two security handlers: Standard Security handler and Public-Key Security handler. Other applications may provide security handlers of their own.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfEncryptionMode.UnKnown
member.summary: The PDF document is encrypted using an unknown security handler.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfEncryptionMode.None
member.summary: The PDF document is not encrypted.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfEncryptionMode.Standard
member.summary: The PDF document is encrypted. The Standard Security Handler has been used for encryption. This handler allows you to define access permissions and up to two passwords - an user password and an owner password.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfEncryptionMode.PublicKey
member.summary: The PDF document is encrypted. The Public-Key Security Handler has been used for encryption. This handler allows you to specify unique permissions for different recipients.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfDestinationType
member.summary: Defines a particular view of a specified page in a PDF document. It is always tied to a given page. It consists of the location of the document window on that page and of the magnification (zoom) factor to use when displaying that page.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeUndefined
member.summary: Undefined page destination type.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeXYZ
member.summary: Displays the specific page with the coordinates (left, top) positioned at the upper-left corner of the window and the content of that page magnified by the zoom factor. A null value for any of the parameters left, top, or zoom specifies, that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged. A zoom value of 0 has the same meaning as a null value.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeFit
member.summary: Displays the specific page with its content magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the page within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeFitH
member.summary: Displays the specific page with the vertical coordinate (top) positioned at the top edge of the window and the content of that page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of the page within the window. A null value for top specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeFitV
member.summary: Displays the specific page with the horizontal coordinate (left) positioned at the left edge of the window and the content of that page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of the page within the window. A null value for left specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeFitR
member.summary: Displays the specific page with its content magnified just enough to fit the rectangle specified by the coordinates left, bottom, right, and top entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the rectangle within the window in the other dimension. A null value for any of the parameters may result in unpredictable behavior.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeFitB
member.summary: (PDF 1.1) Displays the specific page with its content magnified just enough to fit its bounding box entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the bounding box within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeFitBH
member.summary: (PDF 1.1) Displays the specific page with the vertical coordinate (top) positioned at the top edge of the window and the content of that page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of its bounding box within the window. A null value for top specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeFitBV
member.summary: (PDF 1.1) Displays the specific page with the horizontal coordinate (left) positioned at the left edge of the window and the content of that page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of its bounding box within the window. A null value for left specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfColorSpace
member.summary: Specifies a color space.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceUnknown
member.summary: Unknown color space.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceDeviceGray
member.summary: Controls the intensity of achromatic light, on a scale from black to white.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceDeviceRGB
member.summary: Controls the intensities of red, green, and blue light, the three additive primary colors used in displays.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceDeviceCMYK
member.summary: Controls the concentrations of cyan, magenta, yellow, and black inks, the four subtractive process colors used in printing.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceCalGray
member.summary: Special case of a single-component CIE-based color space, known as a CIE-based A color space.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceCalRGB
member.summary: Specifies a CIE-based ABC color space with only one transformation stage instead of two.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceLab
member.summary: Specifies a CIE-based ABC color space with two transformation stages.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceICCBased
member.summary: Specifies a color space based on a cross-platform color profile as defined by the International Color Consortium (ICC).

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceIndexed
member.summary: An Indexed color space allows a PDF content stream to use small integers as indices into a color map or color table of arbitrary colors in some other space.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpacePattern
member.summary: A Pattern color space (PDF 1.2) enables a PDF content stream to paint an area with a pattern rather than a single color.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceSeparation
member.summary: A Separation color space (PDF 1.2) provides a means for specifying the use of additional colorants or for isolating the control of individual color components of a device color space for a subtractive device.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceDeviceN
member.summary: DeviceN color spaces (PDF 1.3) can contain an arbitrary number of color components. They provide greater flexibility than is possible with standard device color spaces such as DeviceCMYK or with individual Separation color spaces.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfBlendMode
member.summary: Defines the blend function used in the compositing formula to customize the blending operation.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeNormal
member.summary: Selects the source color, ignoring the backdrop.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeMultiply
member.summary: Multiplies the backdrop and source color values. The result color is always at least as dark as either of the two constituent colors. Multiplying any color with black produces black; multiplying with white leaves the original color unchanged. Painting successive overlapping objects with a color other than black or white produces progressively darker colors.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeScreen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result. The result color is always at least as light as either of the two constituent colors. Screening any color with white produces white; screening with black leaves the original color unchanged. The effect is similar to projecting multiple photographic slides simultaneously onto a single screen.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeOverLay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value. Source colors overlay the backdrop while preserving its highlights and shadows. The backdrop color is not replaced but is mixed with the source color to reflect the lightness or darkness of the backdrop.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeDarken
member.summary: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors. The backdrop is replaced with the source where the source is darker; otherwise, it is left unchanged.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeLighten
member.summary: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors. The backdrop is replaced with the source where the source is lighter; otherwise, it is left unchanged.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeColorDodge
member.summary: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with black produces no changes.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with white produces no change.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeHardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a harsh spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeSoftLight
member.summary: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeDifference
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color. Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeExclusion
member.summary: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast. Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeHue
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeSaturation
member.summary: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color. Painting with this mode in an area of the backdrop that is a pure gray (no saturation) produces no change.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeColor
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color. This preserves the gray levels of the backdrop and is useful for coloring monochrome images or tinting color images.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeLuminosity
member.summary: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color. This produces an inverse effect to that of the Color mode.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfLineCapStyle
member.summary: Specifies the shape to be used at the ends of open subpaths (and dashes, if any) when they are stroked.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfLineCapStyle.PdfLineCapStyleButt
member.summary: Butt cap. The stroke is squared off at the endpoint of the path. There is no projection beyond the end of the path.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfLineCapStyle.PdfLineCapStyleRound
member.summary: Round cap. A semicircular arc with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn around the endpoint and filled in.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfLineCapStyle.PdfLineCapStyleProjectingSquare
member.summary: Projecting square cap. The stroke continues beyond the endpoint of the path for a distance equal to half the line width and is squared off.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfLineJoinStyle
member.summary: Specifies the shape of joints between connected segments of a stroked path.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfLineJoinStyle.PdfLineJoinStyleMiter
member.summary: The outer edges of the strokes for the two segments are extended until they meet at an angle, as in a picture frame. If the segments meet at too sharp an angle (as defined by the miter limit parameter), a bevel join is used instead.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfLineJoinStyle.PdfLineJoinStyleRound
member.summary: An arc of a circle with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn around the point where the two segments meet, connecting the outer edges of the strokes for the two segments. This pieslice-shaped figure is filled in, producing a rounded corner.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfLineJoinStyle.PdfLineJoinStyleBevel
member.summary: The two segments are finished with butt caps and the resulting notch beyond the ends of the segments is filled with a triangle.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfAdvancedImageCompression
member.summary: Specifies a method to enhance image compression in PDF documents.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAdvancedImageCompression.PdfAdvancedImageCompressionNone
member.summary: No enhancement.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAdvancedImageCompression.PdfAdvancedImageCompressionColorDetection
member.summary: Method based on color detection on the full bitmap.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfAdvancedImageCompression.PdfAdvancedImageCompressionMRC
member.summary:
Mixed raster content (MRC) compression, it uses image segmentation to compress areas with the optimum algorithm based on their characteristics. This method produces optimal results with document mixing text, graphics and images.
The minimum supported PDF version is 1.5 when using this compression. The toolkit will automatically upgrade the PDF conformance if needed.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfCompression
member.summary: Specifies the standard scheme to be used to compress image data in PDF documents.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfCompression.PdfCompressionUnknown
member.summary: Unknown compression.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfCompression.PdfCompressionNone
member.summary: No compression.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfCompression.PdfCompressionFlate
member.summary: Zlib/deflate compression method.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfCompression.PdfCompressionCCITT4
member.summary: CCITT 4 facsimile standard.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfCompression.PdfCompressionJPEG
member.summary: DCT (discrete cosine transform) technique based on the JPEG standard.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfCompression.PdfCompressionJBIG2
member.summary: JBIG2 standard.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfCompression.PdfCompressionJPEG2000
member.summary: Wavelet-based JPEG2000 standard.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfStandardFont
member.summary: A complete set of 14 standard fonts (Standard Type 1 Fonts) that can be used without prior definition.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfStandardFont.PdfStandardFontCourier
member.summary: Font with the standard name Courier, the alternative name is CourierNew.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfStandardFont.PdfStandardFontCourierOblique
member.summary: Font with the standard name Courier-Oblique, the alternative name is CourierNew,Italic.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfStandardFont.PdfStandardFontCourierBold
member.summary: Font with the standard name Courier-Bold, the alternative name is CourierNew,Bold.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfStandardFont.PdfStandardFontCourierBoldOblique
member.summary: Font with the standard name Courier-BoldOblique, the alternative name is CourierNew,BoldItalic.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfStandardFont.PdfStandardFontHelvetica
member.summary: Font with the standard name Helvetica, the alternative name is Arial.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfStandardFont.PdfStandardFontHelveticaOblique

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfPortFolioType
member.summary: The initial view mode for the PDF Portfolio. It is the way the user can view the component files after opening the PDF Portfolio file.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfPortFolioType.Detail
member.summary: The collection view is presented in details mode, with all information in the Schema dictionary presented in a multi-column format. This mode provides the most information to the user. The default value.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfPortFolioType.Tile
member.summary: The collection view is presented in tile mode, with each file in the collection denoted by a small icon and a subset of information from the Schema dictionary. This mode provides top-level information about the file attachments to the user.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfPortFolioType.Hiden
member.summary: The collection view is initially hidden, without preventing the user from obtaining a file list via explicit action.

member.summary: Specifies different options when merging PDF documents.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfDocumentMergingOptions.ExcludeAttachments
member.summary: Files attached to the source document are ignored during the merging process.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfRemoveJavaScriptOptions
member.summary: Defines different objects in the PDF document, which are cleaned from contained JavaScript scripts.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRemoveJavaScriptOptions.None
member.summary: None of all JavaScript scripts included in the document will be removed.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRemoveJavaScriptOptions.RemoveDocumentActions
member.summary: All document actions (based on JavaScript scripts) will be removed from the document.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRemoveJavaScriptOptions.RemoveGlobalJavaScript
member.summary: All global JavaScript scripts will be removed from the document.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRemoveJavaScriptOptions.RemovePageActionsJavaScript
member.summary: All page level JavaScript scripts will be removed from the document.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRemoveJavaScriptOptions.RemoveAnnotationActionsJavaScript
member.summary: All annotation actions, which contain JavaScript scripts, will be removed from the document.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRemoveJavaScriptOptions.RemoveBookmarkActionsJavaScript
member.summary: All bookmark actions, which contain JavaScript scripts, will be removed from the document.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PdfRemoveJavaScriptOptions.RemoveAllJavascript
member.summary: It is the default option. That means all JavaScript scripts will be removed from the document and its related objects.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.PdfTabOrderType
member.summary: Specifies different options for tab key navigation through annotations and interactive forms on a page, so called Tab Order.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.ColorDropoutFilter
member.summary: Specifies the color to be removed/filtered from the image.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ColorDropoutFilter.Red
member.summary: Removes the red color (pixels are set to white).

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ColorDropoutFilter.Magenta
member.summary: Removes the magenta color (pixels are set to white).

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ColorDropoutFilter.Blue
member.summary: Removes the blue color (pixels are set to white).

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ColorDropoutFilter.Cyan
member.summary: Removes the cyan color (pixels are set to white).

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ColorDropoutFilter.Green
member.summary: Removes the green color (pixels are set to white).

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ColorDropoutFilter.Yellow
member.summary: Removes the yellow color (pixels are set to white).

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ColorDropoutFilter.MoreRed
member.summary: Removes more red color. Compared to the Red filter, it also removes a bit of yellow and magenta.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ColorDropoutFilter.MoreMagenta
member.summary: Removes more magenta (pixels are set to white). Compared to the Magenta filter, it also removes a bit of red and blue.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ColorDropoutFilter.MoreBlue
member.summary: Removes more blue (pixels are set to white). Compared to the Blue filter, it also removes a bit of magenta and cyan.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ColorDropoutFilter.MoreCyan
member.summary: Removes more cyan (pixels are set to white). Compared to the Cyan filter, it also removes a bit of blue and green.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ColorDropoutFilter.MoreGreen
member.summary: Removes more green (pixels are set to white). Compared to the Green filter, it also removes a bit of cyan and yellow.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ColorDropoutFilter.MoreYellow
member.summary: Removes more yellow (pixels are set to white). Compared to the Yellow filter, it also removes a bit of green and red.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ColorDropoutFilter.BlackForm
member.summary: This filter is dedicated to black forms (pixels are set to white). It removes the black pixels that are part of the blank form.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ColorDropoutFilter.RedForm
member.summary: This filter is dedicated to red forms (pixels are set to white). It removes the black pixels that are part of the blank form.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ColorDropoutFilter.BlueForm
member.summary: This filter is dedicated to blue forms (pixels are set to white). It removes the blue pixels that are part of the blank form.

member.summary: Save data as half with piz-based wavelet compression.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ExrCompression.ExrCompressionFloat
member.summary: Save data as float instead of as half (not recommended).

member.summary: Save with piz-based wavelet compression.

member.summary: Save with lossy 24-bit float compression.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ExrCompression.ExrCompressionB44
member.summary: Save with lossy 44% float compression - goes to 22% when combined with ExrCompressionLC.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ExrCompression.ExrCompressionLC
member.summary: Save images with one luminance and two chroma channels, rather than as RGB (lossy compression).

member.name: T:GdPicture14.Operators
member.summary: Specifies used operators when combining images.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.Operators.OperatorAnd
member.summary: Pixel = Pixel And Source.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.Operators.OperatorOr
member.summary: Pixel = Pixel Or Source.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.Operators.OperatorXor
member.summary: Pixel = Pixel Xor Source.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.Operators.OperatorMin
member.summary: Pixel = Min(Pixel, Source).

member.name: F:GdPicture14.Operators.OperatorMax
member.summary: Pixel = Max(Pixel, Source).

member.name: F:GdPicture14.Operators.OperatorAbs
member.summary: Pixel = Abs(Pixel, Source).

member.name: F:GdPicture14.Operators.OperatorMultiply
member.summary: Pixel = (Pixel * Source) / 255.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.Operators.OperatorDivide
member.summary: Pixel = Pixel / Source.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.Operators.OperatorPlus
member.summary: Pixel = Pixel + Source.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.Operators.OperatorLess
member.summary: Pixel = Pixel - Source.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.TextAlignment
member.summary: Defines how text is aligned.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.TextAlignment.TextAlignmentNear
member.summary: The text is aligned near the layout. In a left-to-right layout, the near position is left. In a right-to-left layout, the near position is right.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.TextAlignment.TextAlignmentCenter
member.summary: Text is aligned in the center of the layout rectangle.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.TextAlignment.TextAlignmentFar
member.summary: Text is aligned far from the origin position of the layout rectangle. In a left-to-right layout, the far position is right. In a right-to-left layout, the far position is left.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.BitonalReduction
member.summary: Specifies the algorithm to be used to perform black and white effect on images.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.BitonalReduction.NearestColor
member.summary: Each pixel value is compared against a fixed threshold. This may be the simplest dithering algorithm there is, but it results in immense loss of detail and contouring.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.BitonalReduction.OrderedDither
member.summary: Produces a cross-hatch pattern. This is a form of dispersed dithering. Because the dots don't cluster, the result looks much less grainy.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.BitonalReduction.Burke
member.summary: A simplified form of Stucki dithering that is faster, but less clean than Stucki dithering.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.BitonalReduction.Stucki
member.summary: Based on Floyd Steinberg, but is slightly faster. Its output tends to be clean and sharp.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.BitonalReduction.FloydSteinberg
member.summary: Only diffuses the error to neighbouring pixels. This results in very fine-grained dithering.

member.summary: Shrinks the displayed document to the viewer width.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.DisplayQuality
member.summary: Specifies the level of displaying quality according to the algorithm used when images are scaled or rotated.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.DisplayQuality.DisplayQualityLow
member.summary: Low quality interpolation.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.DisplayQuality.DisplayQualityBilinear
member.summary: Bilinear interpolation. No prefiltering is done. This mode is not suitable for shrinking an image below 50 percent of its original size.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.DisplayQuality.DisplayQualityBicubic
member.summary: Bicubic interpolation. No prefiltering is done. This mode is not suitable for shrinking an image below 25 percent of its original size.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.DisplayQuality.DisplayQualityBilinearHQ
member.summary: High-quality bilinear interpolation. Prefiltering is performed to ensure high-quality shrinking.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.DisplayQuality.DisplayQualityBicubicHQ
member.summary: High-quality bicubic interpolation. Prefiltering is performed to ensure high-quality shrinking. This mode produces the highest quality transformed images.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.DisplayQuality.DisplayQualityAutomatic
member.summary: Automatic display quality.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PrintSizeOption.PrintSizeOptionFit
member.summary: Fit page content to paper size.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.PrintSizeOption.PrintSizeOptionShrinkOversized
member.summary: Fit page content to paper size when page size exceed paper size.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode
member.summary: Specifies the foreground mix mode to use when combining the region and the displayed image.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeUNDEFINED
member.summary: Undefined. Do not use.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeBLACK
member.summary: Pixel is always 0.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeNOTMERGEPEN
member.summary: Pixel is the inverse of the ForegroundMixModeMERGEPEN color.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeMASKNOTPEN
member.summary: Pixel is a combination of the colors common to both the pen and the inverse of the screen.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeNOTCOPYPEN
member.summary: Pixel is the inverse of the pen color.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeMASKPENNOT
member.summary: Pixel is a combination of the colors common to both the pen and the inverse of the screen.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeNOT
member.summary: Pixel is the inverse of the screen color.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeXORPEN
member.summary: Pixel is a combination of the colors in the pen and in the screen, but not in both.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeNOTMASKPEN
member.summary: Pixel is the inverse of the ForegroundMixModeMASKPEN color.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeMASKPEN
member.summary: Pixel is a combination of the colors common to both the pen and the screen.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeNOTXORPEN
member.summary: Pixel is the inverse of the R2_XORPEN color.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeNOP
member.summary: Pixel remains unchanged.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeMERGENOTPEN
member.summary: Pixel is a combination of the screen color and the inverse of the pen color.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeCOPYPEN
member.summary: Pixel is the pen color.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeMERGEPENNOT
member.summary: Pixel is a combination of the pen color and the inverse of the screen color.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeMERGEPEN
member.summary: Pixel is a combination of the pen color and the screen color.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeWHITE
member.summary: Pixel is always 1.

member.summary: The quartile level up to 25% damage can be restored.

member.summary: The high level up to 30% damage can be restored.
