member.name: T:GdPicture14.BarcodeQREncodingMode
member.summary:
Defines the encoding mode for QR barcode.
You can find more information here.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.BarcodeQREncodingMode.BarcodeQREncodingModeUndefined
member.summary: The engine selects the most appropriate mode automatically according to the input data.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.BarcodeQREncodingMode.BarcodeQREncodingModeNumeric
member.summary: Numeric encoding (10 bits per 3 digits).

member.name: F:GdPicture14.BarcodeQREncodingMode.BarcodeQREncodingModeAlphaNumeric
member.summary: Alphanumeric encoding (11 bits per 2 characters).

member.name: F:GdPicture14.BarcodeQREncodingMode.BarcodeQREncodingModeByte
member.summary: Byte encoding (8 bits per character).

member.name: F:GdPicture14.BarcodeQREncodingMode.BarcodeQREncodingModeKanji
member.summary: Kanji encoding (13 bits per character).

member.name: T:GdPicture14.BarcodePDF417EncodingMode
member.summary:
Defines the encoding mode for PDF 417 barcode.
You can find more information here.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.BarcodePDF417EncodingMode.BarcodePDF417EncodingModeUndefined
member.summary: The engine selects the most appropriate mode automatically according to the input data.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.BarcodePDF417EncodingMode.BarcodePDF417EncodingModeText
member.summary: Text encoding. Each code word represents two base-30 digits.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.BarcodePDF417EncodingMode.BarcodePDF417EncodingModeByte
member.summary: Byte encoding. Each group of 5 code words represents 6 bytes.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.BarcodePDF417EncodingMode.BarcodePDF417EncodingModeNumeric
member.summary: Numeric encoding. n digits are encoded in n/3+1 code words, up to a maximum of 44 digits in 15 code words.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.BarcodePDF417ErrorCorrectionLevel

member.name: T:GdPicture14.DespeckleType
member.summary: Specifies advanced despeckle types.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.DespeckleType.FourConnected
member.summary: The four connected despeckle removes all the groups of connected black pixels with a number of black pixels below a threshold computed based on the requested despeckle strength. The group of connected pixels is computed by taking into consideration the following directions: above, below, right and left. As a result, diagonals are not taken into consideration, which may cause some thin slanted lines to be removed.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.DespeckleType.FourConnectedNeighborhood
member.summary: The four connected despeckle neighborhood removes all the groups of connected black pixels with a number of black pixels below a threshold computed based on the despeckle strength and not close to larger component. The distance is also computed based on the strength. The group of connected pixels is computed by taking into consideration the following directions: above, below, right and left. As a result, diagonals are not taken into consideration, which may cause some thin slanted lines to be removed.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.DespeckleType.FourConnectedWhite
member.summary: The four connected white despeckle removes all the groups of connected white pixels with a number of white pixels below a threshold computed based on the requested despeckle strength. The group of connected pixels is computed by taking into consideration the following directions: above, below, right and left. As a result, diagonals are not taken into consideration, which may cause some thin slanted lines to be removed.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.DespeckleType.FourConnectedNeighborhoodWhite
member.summary: The four connected white despeckle neighborhood removes all the groups of connected white pixels with a number of white pixels below a threshold computed based on the despeckle strength and not close to larger component. The distance is also computed based on the strength. The group of connected pixels is computed by taking into consideration the following directions: above, below, right and left. As a result, diagonals are not taken into consideration, which may cause some thin slanted lines to be removed.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.DespeckleType.Connected
member.summary: The connected despeckle removes all the groups of connected black pixels with a number of black pixels below a threshold computed based on the requested despeckle strength. The group of connected pixels is computed by taking into consideration all directions.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.DespeckleType.ConnectedNeighborhood
member.summary: The connected despeckle neighborhood removes all the groups of connected black pixels with a number of black pixels below a threshold computed based on the despeckle strength and not close to larger component. The distance is also computed based on the strength. The group of connected pixels is computed by taking into consideration all directions.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.DespeckleType.ConnectedWhite
member.summary: The connected white despeckle removes all the groups of connected white pixels with a number of white pixels below a threshold computed based on the requested despeckle strength. The group of connected pixels is computed by taking into consideration all directions.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.DespeckleType.ConnectedNeighborhoodWhite
member.summary: The connected white despeckle neighborhood removes all the groups of connected white pixels with a number of white pixels below a threshold computed based on the despeckle strength and not close to larger component. The distance is also computed based on the strength. The group of connected pixels is computed by taking into consideration all directions.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.OCRContext
member.summary: Specifies the OCR context, i.e. the layout type of the data, you want to process using the OCR.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.OCRContext.OCRContextDocument
member.summary: For document with variable layout with lines, text or/and images. Recommended and used as the default value.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.OCRContext.OCRContextSingleColumn
member.summary: For single column of text of variable sizes.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.OCRContext.OCRContextSingleBlock
member.summary: For document with single uniform block of text.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.OCRContext.OCRContextSingleBlockVertical
member.summary: For document with single uniform block of vertically aligned text.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.OCRContext.OCRContextSingleLine
member.summary: For single text line image.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.OCRContext.OCRContextSingleWord
member.summary: For single word image.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.OCRContext.OCRContextSingleWordCircle
member.summary: For single word in a circle image.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.OCRContext.OCRContextSingleChar
member.summary: For single character image.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.OCRContext.OCRContextSparseText
member.summary: Find as much text as possible in no particular order.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.OCRContext.OCRContextRawLine
member.summary: Treat the image as a single text line, bypassing hacks that are Tesseract-specific.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.OCRContext.OCRContextSegmentationOnly
member.summary: Do only the segmentation. Do not recognize any character.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.OCRParagraphJustification
member.summary: Specifies a paragraph justification.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.OCRParagraphJustification.Unknown
member.summary: The alignment is not quite clear. This can happen, if there are only one or two lines of text or the text looks like source code or poetry.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.OCRParagraphJustification.Left
member.summary: Each line, except possibly the first, is flush with the same left tab stop.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.OCRParagraphJustification.Center
member.summary: The text lines of the paragraph are centered about a line going down through the middle of the text lines.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.OCRParagraphJustification.Right
member.summary: Each line, except possibly the first, is flush with the same right tab stop.

member.name: T:GdPicture14.RenderingEngine
member.summary: Defines the application programming interface used to render content.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.RenderingEngine.GdiPlus
member.summary:
GdiPlus.
Pros: very fast path painting. Low memory usage.
Cons: uses internal lock which considerably decreases performance when used in multiple threads. Slow image rendering.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.RenderingEngine.WPF
member.summary:
Windows Presentation Foundation.
Pros: supports antialiasing in clipping path. Fast image rendering. Produces very high performance in multithreaded applications.
Cons: slower path painting than GdiPlus. Requires more memory than GdiPlus.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.RenderingEngine.Skia
member.summary: Do not use yet.

member.name: F:GdPicture14.RenderingEngine.Hybrid
member.summary: This engine mix all supported programming interfaces in order to favor rendering quality, speed and multithread performance.

member.name: P:GdPicture.Internal.Viewer.ViewerController.DocumentAlignment
member.summary: Default image alignment within the viewer when the area of the viewer if smaller than the displayed document in its current zoom configuration. Setting this property to DocumentAlignmentTopLeft has the effect to display the most top-left part of the displayed page during "Zoom In" operations. Default value is ViewerDocumentAlignment.DocumentAlignmentMiddleCenter.

member.name: P:GdPicture.Internal.Viewer.ViewerController.KeepDocumentPosition
member.summary: Specifies if the viewer must keep the page position when the displayed page changes or when a new document is loaded. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture.Internal.Viewer.ViewerController.ZoomAtCursorPos
member.summary: Specifies if the document must ce centered to the latest provided cursor position when a zoom operation is performed. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture.Internal.Viewer.ViewerController.DocumentPosition
member.summary: Default page position within the viewer when the rendering area of the displayed document in its current zoom configuration if smaller than then area of the viewer. Default value is ViewerDocumentPosition.DocumentPositionMiddleCenter.

member.name: T:GdPicture.Internal.Utils.StreamUtils.BitStreamReader
member.summary: A stream-style reader for retrieving packed bits from a byte array. Ref: http://referencesource.microsoft.com/#PresentationCore/Shared/MS/Internal/Ink/BitStream.cs,6a7d84e516b71ab0
member.remarks: This bits should packed into the leftmost position in each byte. For compatibility purposes with the v1 ISF encoder and decoder, the order of the packing must not be changed. This code is a from-scratch rewrite of the BitStream natice C++ class in the v1 Ink code, but still maintaining the same packing behavior.

member.name: T:GdPicture.Internal.Utils.StreamUtils.BitStreamWriter
member.summary: A stream-like writer for packing bits into a byte buffer. Ref: http://referencesource.microsoft.com/#PresentationCore/Shared/MS/Internal/Ink/BitStream.cs,6a7d84e516b71ab0
member.remarks: This class is to be used with the BitStreamReader for reading and writing bytes. Note that the bytes should be read in the same order and lengths as they were written to retrieve the same values. See remarks in BitStreamReader regarding compatibility with the native C++ BitStream class.

member.name: M:GdPicture.Internal.PDF.Text.PDFStringGlobals.ToPDFNameU(System.String)
member.summary:
A name object is an atomic symbol uniquely defined by a sequence of characters. Uniquely defined means that any two name objects made up of the same sequence of characters are identically the same object. Atomic means that a name has no public structure; although it is defined by a sequence of characters, those characters are not considered elements of the name. A slash character(/) introduces a name.The slash is not part of the name but is a prefix indicating that the following sequence of characters constitutes a name.There can be no white-space characters between the slash and the first character in the name. The name may include any regular characters, but not delimiter or white-space characters (see Section 3.1, Lexical Conventions).
Beginning with PDF 1.2, any character except null (character code 0) may be included in a name by writing its 2-digit hexadecimal code, preceded by the number sign character (#); see implementation notes 3 and 4 in Appendix H. This syntax is required to represent any of the delimiter or white-space characters or the number sign character itself; it is recommended but not required for characters whose codes are outside the range 33 (!) to 126 (~). Uppercase and lowercase letters are considered distinct: /A and /a are different names

member.name: F:GdPicture.Internal.Fonts.FontTrueTypeheadTable.macStyle
member.summary: Bit 0: Bold (if set to 1); Bit 1: Italic (if set to 1) Bit 2: Underline (if set to 1) Bit 3: Outline (if set to 1) Bit 4: Shadow (if set to 1) Bit 5: Condensed (if set to 1) Bit 6: Extended (if set to 1) Bits 7-15: Reserved (set to 0).

member.name: T:GdPicture.Internal.Fonts.FontTrueTypehheaTable
member.summary: The 'hhea' table contains information needed to layout fonts whose characters are written horizontally, that is, either left to right or right to left. This table contains information that is general to the font as a whole. Information which pertains to specific glyphs is given in the 'hmtx' table.

member.summary: Specifies the line external leading, computed for Windows, in design units, of this font. The formula is WinExternalLeading = LineSpacing - (WinAscent + WinDescent).

member.name: P:GdPicture.Internal.Fonts.GdPictureFont.LineSpacing
member.summary: Specifies the line spacing, in design units, of this font. The line spacing is the vertical distance between the base lines of two consecutive lines of text. The value is computed using the formula: LineSpacing = Ascent + Math.Abs(Descent) + LineGap.

member.summary: Returns the number of glyphs contains in the font.

member.name: T:GdPicture.Internal.Fonts.GdPictureFontExt
member.summary: Handles a GdPictureFont structure with faux bold and faux italic support.
member.remarks: Faux bold and faux italic are terms used by Adobe PhotoShop to indicate fonts without version bold or italic available which are modifyed by code in the printing time to feign the attributes.

member.name: M:GdPicture.Internal.Fonts.TrueType.FontTrueTypeParser.CreateSubset(GdPicture.Internal.Fonts.TrueType.FontTrueTypeParser,System.UInt32[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[]@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create Subset Method - assembles new font file subset based on input glyphs and original font file.
member.param: Array of glyph identifiers that should be included in new font file.
Byte array containing original full font file data that will be used to create new subset.
Output Byte array containing new created subset font data.

member.name: P:GdPicture.Internal.Fonts.TrueType.FontTrueTypeParser.TypoAscender
member.summary: Specifies the typo cell ascent, in design units, of this font.

member.name: P:GdPicture.Internal.Fonts.TrueType.FontTrueTypeParser.TypoDescender
member.summary: Specifies the typo cell descent, in design units, of this font.

member.name: P:GdPicture.Internal.Fonts.TrueType.FontTrueTypeParser.WinLineSpacing
member.summary: Specifies the line spacing, computed for Windows, in design units, of this font. The line spacing is the vertical distance between the base lines of two consecutive lines of text. The value is computed using the formula: LineSpacing = Ascent + Math.Abs(Descent) + LineGap.
member.remarks: Win Ascent and Win Descent are supposed to be the Windows metrics, while Ascender and Descender are supposed to be the Apple metrics, but in the case of line spacing, Microsoft has decided to look at both, and pick the larger value when returning Line Spacing calculation. ref: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms533824(v=vs.85).aspx

member.name: P:GdPicture.Internal.Fonts.TrueType.FontTrueTypeParser.TypoLineGap
member.summary: Specifies the typo line gap, in design units, of this font.

member.name: P:GdPicture.Internal.Imaging.GdPictureImage.Photometric
member.summary: Returns the photometric of the image. 0 = WhiteIsZero. For bilevel and grayscale images: 0 is imaged as white. 1 = BlackIsZero.For bilevel and grayscale images: 0 is imaged as black. 2 = RGB.RGB value of(0,0,0) represents black, and (255, 255, 255) represents white, assuming 8-bit components.The components are stored in the indicated order: first Red, then Green, then Blue. 3 = Palette color.

member.name: M:GdPicture.Internal.Imaging.Document.Layout.PageLayout.GetBlockAt(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the block at the given index within the provided array.
member.param: The handle to the array.
The 0 based index of the item within the array.
member.returns: The block.

members.member:
DerefResult extracts the Ocr results from the provided Tesseract data structures pointers.
The coordinates retrieved by the engine are relative to the image, ie. the coordinates stored within Tesseract* struct are related to the top left corner of the image. The coordinates retrieved to the integrator are relative to the ROI, ie. the coordinates stored within Ocr* struct are related to the top left corner of the ROI. To retrieve the list of blocks.To retrieve the list of paragraphs.To retrieve the list of text lines.To retrieve the list of words.To retrieve the list of characters.The adress of the buffer with the blocks.The number of blocks.The adress of the buffer with the paragraphs.The adress of the buffer with the text lines.The adress of the buffer with the words.The adress of the buffer with the characters.

member.summary: DerefWords dereferences the words and the characters within a text line.
member.param: To retrieve the list of words.
To retrieve the list of characters.
The global index for the words.
The global index for the characters.
The text line.
The handle to the buffer containg all the words.
The handle to the buffer containg all the characters.
